question: 好む
sourceMnemonic: You know that <ja>好き</ja> is "like." Although <ja>好き</ja> is kind of like a verb already, this is definitely a verb. It can be <vocabulary>to be fond of</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to like</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is a strange one, different from anything you've learned, kanji on'yomi or vocab kun'yomi. The reading is <ja>この</ja>, so think of this. What is it that you're particularly fond of? Getting a <reading>cone</reading> (<ja>この</ja>) with your ice cream (which you're also fond of, who isn't?). Think of all the different cones you can get: waffle cones, sugar cones, oreo cones, yum!
